raw: * Base class for all layout managers.
* Custom layout manager must derive from
* this class and implement the methods {@link #invalidateLayoutCache},
* {@link #renderLayout} and {@link #getSizeHint}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Base class for all layout managers. Custom layout manager must derive from this class and implement the methods {@link #invalidateLayoutCache}, {@link #renderLayout} and {@link #getSizeHint}.

raw: * @type {Map} The cached size hint
* @type {Boolean} Whether the children cache is valid. This field is protected
*    because sub classes must be able to access it quickly.

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{Boolean} Whether the children cache is valid. This field is protected
    because sub classes must be able to access it quickly.

raw: * @type {qx.ui.core.Widget} The connected widget
* Invalidate all layout relevant caches. Automatically deletes the size hint.
* @abstract

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Invalidate all layout relevant caches. Automatically deletes the size hint.

raw: * Applies the children layout.
* @abstract
* @param availWidth {Integer} Final width available for the content (in pixel)
* @param availHeight {Integer} Final height available for the content (in pixel)
* @param padding {Map} Map containing the padding values. Keys:
* top, bottom, left, right

@param.name: @param
@param.body: availWidth {Integer} Final width available for the content (in pixel)
@param.description: Final width available for the content (in pixel)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: availHeight {Integer} Final height available for the content (in pixel)
@param.description: Final height available for the content (in pixel)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: padding {Map} Map containing the padding values. Keys: top, bottom, left, right
@param.description: Map containing the padding values. Keys: top, bottom, left, right

raw: * Computes the layout dimensions and possible ranges of these.
* @return {Map|null} The map with the preferred width/height and the allowed
*   minimum and maximum values in cases where shrinking or growing
* is required. Can also return null when this detection
*   is not supported by the layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes the layout dimensions and possible ranges of these.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map|null} The map with the preferred width/height and the allowed minimum and maximum values in cases where shrinking or growing is required. Can also return null when this detection is not supported by the layout.
@return.description: The map with the preferred width/height and the allowed minimum and maximum values in cases where shrinking or growing is required. Can also return null when this detection is not supported by the layout.

raw: * Whether the layout manager supports height for width.
* @return {Boolean} Whether the layout manager supports height for width

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the layout manager supports height for width.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the layout manager supports height for width
@return.description: Whether the layout manager supports height for width

raw: * If layout wants to trade height for width it has to implement this
* method and return the preferred height if it is resized to
* the given width. This function returns null if the item
* do not support height for width.
* @param width {Integer} The computed width
* @return {Integer} The desired height

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If layout wants to trade height for width it has to implement this method and return the preferred height if it is resized to the given width. This function returns null if the item do not support height for width.

raw: * This computes the size hint of the layout and returns it.
* @abstract
* @return {Map} The size hint.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This computes the size hint of the layout and returns it.

raw: * This method is called, on each child "add" and "remove" action and
* whenever the layout data of a child is changed. The method should be used
* to clear any children relevant cached data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method is called, on each child "add" and "remove" action and whenever the layout data of a child is changed. The method should be used to clear any children relevant cached data.

raw: * Verifies the value of a layout property.
* Note: This method is only available in the debug builds.
* @signature function(item, name, value)
* @param item {Object} The affected layout item
* @param name {Object} Name of the layout property
* @param value {Object} Value of the layout property

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Verifies the value of a layout property. Note: This method is only available in the debug builds.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {Object} Name of the layout property

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Object} Value of the layout property

raw: * Remove all currently visible separators
* Renders a separator between two children
* @param separator {String|qx.ui.decoration.IDecorator} The separator to render
* @param bounds {Map} Contains the left and top coordinate and the width and height
*    of the separator to render.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
bounds {Map} Contains the left and top coordinate and the width and height
    of the separator to render.
@param.description:
Contains the left and top coordinate and the width and height
    of the separator to render.

raw: * This method is called by the widget to connect the widget with the layout.
* @param widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to connect to.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method is called by the widget to connect the widget with the layout.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to connect to.

raw: * Return the widget that is this layout is responsible for.
* @return {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget connected to this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the widget that is this layout is responsible for.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget connected to this layout.
@return.description: The widget connected to this layout.

raw: * Indicate that the layout has layout changed and propagate this information
* up the widget hierarchy.
* Also a generic property apply method for all layout relevant properties.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Indicate that the layout has layout changed and propagate this information up the widget hierarchy. Also a generic property apply method for all layout relevant properties.

raw: * Returns the list of all layout relevant children.
* @return {Array} List of layout relevant children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the list of all layout relevant children.
